channel.title: CVE Feed for n/a -- Rocket.chat
channel.description: The latest CVEs for n/a -- Rocket.chat

item.title: CVE-2023-28357|2023-05-11T00:00:00 -- n%2Fa -- rocket.chat
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified in Rocket.Chat, where the ACL checks in the Slash Command /mute occur after checking whether a user is a member of a given channel, leaking private channel members to unauthorized users. This allows authenticated users to enumerate whether a username is a member of a channel that they do not have access to.

item.title: CVE-2023-28316|2023-05-09T00:00:00 -- n%2Fa -- rocket.chat
item.description: A security vulnerability has been discovered in the implementation of 2FA on the rocket.chat platform, where other active sessions are not invalidated upon activating 2FA. This could potentially allow an attacker to maintain access to a compromised account even after 2FA is enabled.

item.title: CVE-2023-28317|2023-05-09T00:00:00 -- n%2Fa -- rocket.chat
item.description: A vulnerability has been discovered in Rocket.Chat, where editing messages can change the original timestamp, causing the UI to display messages in an incorrect order.

item.title: CVE-2023-28356|2023-05-11T00:00:00 -- n%2Fa -- rocket.chat
item.description: A vulnerability has been identified where a maliciously crafted message containing a specific chain of characters can cause the chat to enter a hot loop on one of the processes, consuming ~120% CPU and rendering the service unresponsive.

item.title: CVE-2023-28318|2023-05-09T00:00:00 -- n%2Fa -- rocket.chat
item.description: A vulnerability has been discovered in Rocket.Chat, where messages can be hidden regardless of the Message_KeepHistory or Message_ShowDeletedStatus server configuration. This allows users to bypass the intended message deletion behavior, hiding messages and deletion notices.

item.title: CVE-2023-28359|2023-05-11T00:00:00 -- n%2Fa -- rocket.chat
item.description: A NoSQL injection vulnerability has been identified in the listEmojiCustom method call within Rocket.Chat. This can be exploited by unauthenticated users when there is at least one custom emoji uploaded to the Rocket.Chat instance. The vulnerability causes a delay in the server response, with the potential for limited impact.

item.title: CVE-2023-28358|2023-05-11T00:00:00 -- n%2Fa -- rocket.chat
item.description: A vulnerability has been discovered in Rocket.Chat where a markdown parsing issue in the "Search Messages" feature allows the insertion of malicious tags. This can be exploited on servers with content security policy disabled possible leading to some issues attacks like account takeover.

item.title: CVE-2023-28325|2023-05-11T00:00:00 -- n%2Fa -- rocket.chat
item.description: An improper authorization vulnerability exists in Rocket.Chat <6.0 that could allow a hacker to manipulate the rid parameter and change the updateMessage method that only checks whether the user is allowed to edit message in the target room.

item.title: CVE-2023-23911|2023-03-10T00:00:00 -- n%2Fa -- rocket.chat
item.description: An improper access control vulnerability exists prior to v6 that could allow an attacker to break the E2E encryption of a chat room by a user changing the group key of a chat room.

item.title: CVE-2023-23917|2023-02-23T00:00:00 -- n%2Fa -- rocket.chat
item.description: A prototype pollution vulnerability exists in Rocket.Chat server <5.2.0 that could allow an attacker to a RCE under the admin account. Any user can create their own server in your cloud and become an admin so this vulnerability could affect the cloud infrastructure. This attack vector also may increase the impact of XSS to RCE which is dangerous for self-hosted users as well.
